datasetFieldTypes.name: unitOfAnalysis
datasetFieldTypes.title: Unit of Analysis
datasetFieldTypes.description: Basic unit of analysis or observation that this Dataset describes, such as individuals, families/households, groups, institutions/organizations, administrative units, and more. For information about the DDI's controlled vocabulary for this element, please refer to the DDI web page at http://www.ddialliance.org/controlled-vocabularies.

datasetFieldTypes.name: universe
datasetFieldTypes.title: Universe
datasetFieldTypes.description: Description of the population covered by the data in the file; the group of people or other elements that are the object of the study and to which the study results refer. Age, nationality, and residence commonly help to  delineate a given universe, but any number of other factors may be used, such as age limits, sex, marital status, race, ethnic group, nationality, income, veteran status, criminal convictions, and more. The universe may consist of elements other than persons, such as housing units, court cases, deaths, countries, and so on. In general, it should be possible to tell from the description of the universe whether a given individual or element is a member of the population under study. Also known as the universe of interest, population of interest, and target population.

datasetFieldTypes.name: timeMethod
datasetFieldTypes.title: Time Method
datasetFieldTypes.description: The time method or time dimension of the data collection, such as panel, cross-sectional, trend, time- series, or other.

datasetFieldTypes.name: dataCollector
datasetFieldTypes.title: Data Collector
datasetFieldTypes.description: Individual, agency or organization responsible for  administering the questionnaire or interview or compiling the data.

datasetFieldTypes.name: collectorTraining
datasetFieldTypes.title: Collector Training
datasetFieldTypes.description: Type of training provided to the data collector

datasetFieldTypes.name: frequencyOfDataCollection
datasetFieldTypes.title: Frequency
datasetFieldTypes.description: If the data collected includes more than one point in time, indicate the frequency with which the data was collected; that is, monthly, quarterly, or other.

datasetFieldTypes.name: samplingProcedure
datasetFieldTypes.title: Sampling Procedure
datasetFieldTypes.description: Type of sample and sample design used to select the survey respondents to represent the population. May include reference to the target sample size and the sampling fraction.

datasetFieldTypes.name: targetSampleSize
datasetFieldTypes.title: Target Sample Size
datasetFieldTypes.description: Specific information regarding the target sample size, actual  sample size, and the formula used to determine this.

datasetFieldTypes.name: targetSampleActualSize
datasetFieldTypes.title: Actual
datasetFieldTypes.description: Actual sample size.

parentDatasetFieldType.name: targetSampleSize
parentDatasetFieldType.title: Target Sample Size
parentDatasetFieldType.description: Specific information regarding the target sample size, actual  sample size, and the formula used to determine this.

datasetFieldTypes.name: targetSampleSizeFormula
datasetFieldTypes.title: Formula
datasetFieldTypes.description: Formula used to determine target sample size.

parentDatasetFieldType.name: targetSampleSize
parentDatasetFieldType.title: Target Sample Size
parentDatasetFieldType.description: Specific information regarding the target sample size, actual  sample size, and the formula used to determine this.

datasetFieldTypes.name: deviationsFromSampleDesign
datasetFieldTypes.title: Major Deviations for Sample Design
datasetFieldTypes.description: Show correspondence as well as discrepancies between the sampled units (obtained) and available statistics for the population (age, sex-ratio, marital status, etc.) as a whole.

datasetFieldTypes.name: collectionMode
datasetFieldTypes.title: Collection Mode
datasetFieldTypes.description: Method used to collect the data; instrumentation characteristics (e.g., telephone interview, mail questionnaire, or other).

datasetFieldTypes.name: researchInstrument
datasetFieldTypes.title: Type of Research Instrument
datasetFieldTypes.description: Type of data collection instrument used. Structured indicates an instrument in which all respondents are asked the same questions/tests, possibly with precoded answers. If a small portion of such a questionnaire includes open-ended questions, provide appropriate comments. Semi-structured indicates that the research instrument contains mainly open-ended questions. Unstructured indicates that in-depth interviews were conducted.

datasetFieldTypes.name: dataCollectionSituation
datasetFieldTypes.title: Characteristics of Data Collection Situation
datasetFieldTypes.description: Description of noteworthy aspects of the data collection situation. Includes information on factors such as cooperativeness of respondents, duration of interviews, number of call backs, or similar.

datasetFieldTypes.name: actionsToMinimizeLoss
datasetFieldTypes.title: Actions to Minimize Losses
datasetFieldTypes.description: Summary of actions taken to minimize data loss. Include information on actions such as follow-up visits, supervisory checks, historical matching, estimation, and so on.

datasetFieldTypes.name: controlOperations
datasetFieldTypes.title: Control Operations
datasetFieldTypes.description: Control OperationsMethods to facilitate data control performed by the primary investigator or by the data archive.

datasetFieldTypes.name: weighting
datasetFieldTypes.title: Weighting
datasetFieldTypes.description: The use of sampling procedures might make it necessary to apply weights to produce accurate statistical results. Describes the criteria for using weights in analysis of a collection. If a weighting formula or coefficient was developed, the formula is provided, its elements are defined, and it is indicated how the formula was applied to the data.

datasetFieldTypes.name: cleaningOperations
datasetFieldTypes.title: Cleaning Operations
datasetFieldTypes.description: Methods used to clean the data collection, such as consistency checking, wildcode checking, or other.

datasetFieldTypes.name: datasetLevelErrorNotes
datasetFieldTypes.title: Study Level Error Notes
datasetFieldTypes.description: Note element used for any information annotating or clarifying the methodology and processing of the study.

datasetFieldTypes.name: responseRate
datasetFieldTypes.title: Response Rate
datasetFieldTypes.description: Percentage of sample members who provided information.

datasetFieldTypes.name: samplingErrorEstimates
datasetFieldTypes.title: Estimates of Sampling Error
datasetFieldTypes.description: Measure of how precisely one can estimate a population value from a given sample.

datasetFieldTypes.name: otherDataAppraisal
datasetFieldTypes.title: Other Forms of Data Appraisal
datasetFieldTypes.description: Other issues pertaining to the data appraisal. Describe issues such as response variance, nonresponse rate  and testing for bias, interviewer and response bias, confidence levels, question bias, or similar.

datasetFieldTypes.name: socialScienceNotes
datasetFieldTypes.title: Notes
datasetFieldTypes.description: General notes about this Dataset.

datasetFieldTypes.name: socialScienceNotesType
datasetFieldTypes.title: Type
datasetFieldTypes.description: Type of note.

datasetFieldTypes.name: socialScienceNotesSubject
datasetFieldTypes.title: Subject
datasetFieldTypes.description: Note subject.

datasetFieldTypes.name: socialScienceNotesText
datasetFieldTypes.title: Text
datasetFieldTypes.description: Text for this note.
